revision.text:
{{Infobox military person | name = Fu Yi | native_name = 傅怡 | native_name_lang = zh-hans | image = | image_size = | alt = | caption = | birth_date = {{Birth year and age|1953|11}} | birth_place = [[Nanjing]], [[Jiangsu]] | death_date = | death_place = | placeofburial = | placeofburial_label = | placeofburial_coordinates = | allegiance = People's Republic of China | branch = [[People's Liberation Army]] | serviceyears = March 1969 – November 2013 | rank = [[File:PLAMjGeneral r.png|47px]] [[Major General]] (Shao Jiang) | servicenumber = | unit = [[1st Group Army]]
[[12th Army (People's Republic of China)|12th Army]]
[[North Sea Fleet]] | commands = Commander of Zhejiang Military Command | awards = | spouse = }} {{Chinese name|[[Fu (surname)|Fu]]}} '''Fu Yi''' ({{zh|s=傅怡|t=傅怡|p=Fù Yí}}; born November 1953) is a [[major general]] in the [[People's Liberation Army]] of China. He was detained by Chinese military authorities in January 2015, suspected of corruption.{{cite news|author= Wang Heyan and Xue Jiancong |url=http://english.caixin.com/2015-03-17/100792072.html |title=Ex-General Who Served in Zhejiang 'Is Target of Inquiry' |newspaper=Caixin |date=March 2015 }} Chinese media reported that he had close relations with [[Guo Zhenggang]], the son of [[Guo Boxiong]], a retired former vice-chairman of the [[Central Military Commission (China)|Central Military Commission]], China's top military body.{{cite news|author=Wang Xiaodong |url= http://africa.chinadaily.com.cn/china/2015-03/18/content_19839967.htm |title=Retired Zhejiang commander probed |newspaper=Chinadaily |date=2015-03-18 |language= |location=}}{{cite web |url=http://news.qq.com/a/20150317/012804.htm |title=浙江省军区原司令员傅怡少将被查 2013年已退休 |accessdate=2015-03-17 |publisher=Tencent |language= zh}} ==Biography== Fu was born and raised in [[Nanjing]], [[Jiangsu]], with his [[Ancestral home (Chinese)|ancestral home]] in [[Jiang County]], [[Shanxi]].{{cite web |url=http://news.china.com/domestic/945/20150317/19391435.html |title= 退休的浙江省军区原司令员傅怡少将被查 |accessdate=2015-03-17 |publisher= |work=China.com |language= zh}} He joined the [[Communist Party of China]] in August 1971 and joined the [[People's Liberation Army]] in March 1969. Fu started his military career in 1980 in [[Nanjing Military Region]]. He served as [[Chief of staff]] of the [[1st Group Army]], Deputy Commander of Lüshun Base of the [[North Sea Fleet]], and Deputy Army Commander of the [[12th Army (People's Republic of China)|12th Army]] before serving as Commander of Zhejiang Military Command.{{cite web |url=http://news.china.com/domestic/945/20150317/19391440.html |title=傅怡个人简历 |accessdate=2015-03-17 |publisher=|work=China.com |language=zh }} Fu retired in November 2013. In March 2015, Chinese media reported that Fu was detained for investigation by military prosecution authorities. ==References== {{reflist}} {{CPCCorruption2013}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Fu, Yi}} [[Category:1953 births]] [[Category:People from Nanjing]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People's Liberation Army generals from Jiangsu]] [[Category:Commanders of the Zhejiang Military District]]
